title: Battlezoo Bestiary for Pathfinder 2e by Roll For Combat
description: The Battlezoo Bestiary for Pathfinder Second Edition contains 114 award-winning monsters, the Monster Parts system, the Monster Mage and Vestige Hunter archetypes, new backgrounds, magic items, and more!

authors.name: Stephen Glicker, Patrick Renie, and Mark Seifter

dundrath.label: Dundrath
dundrath.description: Dundraths are thickset humanoids who resemble woolly mammoths except for their burly arms and hands and keen yellow eyes.

gmayun.label: G'Mayun
gmayun.description: G'mayuns are avian humanoids that resemble colorful parrots and other birds native to tropical paradises.

husk.label: Husk
husk.description: Plant creatures share a special bond with the natural world that few other beings can completely understand or appreciate. When the bond to its realm is broken or severed, a sentient plant creature’s rage can transform it into a terrible shadow of its former self. Benign and even friendly plants like leshies, arboreals, and dryads all run the risk of this horrible metamorphosis, though their own agony often pales in comparison to the horrors which they inflict on their victims. Lonely, angry, and twisted, plant husks sow their monstrous madness in the fertile corpses of wanderers who dare travel through the husk’s blighted swath of wilderness. Though in their eyes any living creature is worthy of obliteration, husks reserve their most horrendous punishments for any litterer, land settler, or lumberjack who ever dared to desecrate, dominate, or denude the forest.

wild-hunt.label: Wild Hunt
wild-hunt.description: The wild hunt is a group of enigmatic fey who hunt prey across not only the fey realm, but across the entire multiverse.
